cards.title: Texas / Biker gangs' gunfight leaves nine dead, say police
cards.rawTitle: Biker gangs' gunfight leaves nine dead, say police

item.title: Texas biker gangs' gunfight leaves nine dead, say police
item.trailText: The nine people killed during a fight at a restaurant in Waco, Texas, were all members of biker gangs, Texas police say
item.standFirst: The nine people killed during a fight at a restaurant in Waco, Texas, were all members of biker gangs, Texas police say. Speaking in a car park near a sports bar where the confrontation between rival biker gangs took place on Sunday, Waco sergeant W Patrick Swanton describes the chaotic scene when police officers arrived

cards.title: Video / Baseball-sized hail stones destroy driver's windscreen
cards.rawTitle: Baseball-sized hail stones destroy driver's windscreen

item.title: Baseball-sized hail stones from Oklahoma tornado destroy driver's windscreen
item.trailText: A tornado outside Tipton, Oklahoma, unleashes hail stones big enough to shatter the windshield of a car from which two people are filming
item.standFirst: A tornado outside Tipton, Oklahoma, unleashes hail stones big enough to shatter the windshield of a car from which two people are filming. The powerful storm system stretched from Texas to Minnesota on Sunday, bringing heavy rains, flash flooding and the possibility of more severe weather. While thousands are without power, no deaths or serious injuries have ben reported

stillImage.caption: A tornado in Oklahoma creates baseball-sized hail stones that crack car windshields. 18 May 2015 Photograph: Reuters Photograph: Reuters
stillImage.cleanCaption: A tornado in Oklahoma creates baseball-sized hail stones that crack car windshields. 18 May 2015 Photograph: Reuters

cards.title: Four-year-old shows off his basketball trick shots
cards.rawTitle: Four-year-old shows off his basketball trick shots

item.title: Four-year-old shows off his basketball trick shots
item.trailText: Four-year-old Zach shows off his basketball trick shots
item.standFirst: Four-year-old Zach shows off his basketball trick shots in the hope that his YouTube trickster heroes will notice and agree to meet him. Zach is obsessed with basketball, he even sleeps with his basketball instead of a teddy bear, say his parents. Zach hopes his impressive basketball skills will get him noticed and help him to meet the people behind the sport trick shot YouTube channel, Dude Perfect

cards.title: Frank Auerbach's London / The extraordinary life and loves

item.title: Frank Auerbach's London: the extraordinary life and loves – in pictures
item.trailText: Auerbach’s canvases reveal his unique vision of London’s streets – from Camden Town caught in vibrant reds and greens, to the autumnal yellow light on Primrose Hill – and the friends who have sat for him over the years
item.standFirst:
With their thick, heavy paint, Auerbach’s canvases reveal his unique vision of London’s streets – from the theatre of Camden Town caught in vibrant reds and greens, to the autumnal yellow light on Primrose Hill – and the friends who have sat for him over the years

  • Frank Auerbach: ‘Painting is the most marvellous activity humans have invented’

item.title: Daniel Frost's Haircuts of Hackney
item.trailText: When he moved to London from Staffordshire, artist Daniel Frost fell in love with the city’s diversity
item.standFirst:
When he moved to London from Staffordshire, artist Daniel Frost fell in love with the city’s diversity. “Everyone was from different parts of the world, with different personalities, characters and styles,” he says. He is now based in Hackney, east London, and in a new fold-out book he celebrates the heads of the varied crowd he sees on his way to the studio every morning. “I didn’t want them to be stand-alone images – they’re meant to be seen together, like a crowd of people. I like how you can capture someone’s personality in a few simple shapes – you can learn a lot about a person from that.”

  • Haircuts of Hackney (Hoxton Mini Press £12.95) is out 20 May

displayImages.caption:
Beardway Market
“As the name suggests this is mainly based on bar staff from Broadway Market,” says Frost. “It’s a modern take on 1950s rockabilly but with a trendy beard, with the tattoos feeding out of the back of the shirt. It’s the perfect look to show that side of Hackney.”
displayImages.altText: Beardway Market
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Beardway Market
“As the name suggests this is mainly based on bar staff from Broadway Market,” says Frost. “It’s a modern take on 1950s rockabilly but with a trendy beard, with the tattoos feeding out of the back of the shirt. It’s the perfect look to show that side of Hackney.”

displayImages.caption:
Fro Control
“This one comes from near Homerton way. If you go down Mirth Street, it’s a haircut you see quite a lot around that area. I find it fascinating when a haircut becomes more about shape and scale, more sculptural like this.”
displayImages.altText: Fro Control
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Fro Control
“This one comes from near Homerton way. If you go down Mirth Street, it’s a haircut you see quite a lot around that area. I find it fascinating when a haircut becomes more about shape and scale, more sculptural like this.”

displayImages.caption:
Man Bun (Mun)
“This definitely had to be in the book, because it’s a haircut you see around so much. It’s not just a particular sort of person that has that kind of haircut: it’s lots of different personalities. And it’s got a good name.”
displayImages.altText: Man Bun (Mun)
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Man Bun (Mun)
“This definitely had to be in the book, because it’s a haircut you see around so much. It’s not just a particular sort of person that has that kind of haircut: it’s lots of different personalities. And it’s got a good name.”

displayImages.caption:
London Fields
“This is the first one where the name inspired the haircut more than the other way around. It’s Hackney in the summertime: the freedom and hippie vibes of London Fields. It feels like summer starts in that sort of park.”
displayImages.altText: London Fields
displayImages.cleanCaption:
London Fields
“This is the first one where the name inspired the haircut more than the other way around. It’s Hackney in the summertime: the freedom and hippie vibes of London Fields. It feels like summer starts in that sort of park.”

displayImages.caption:
Bit on the Side
“That’s the rebellious side of Hackney that you see quite late at night, maybe near one of the bagel shops. I suppose it’s the alternative side of Hackney, still reminiscent of the punk culture that fixates around there.”
displayImages.altText: Bit on the Side
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Bit on the Side
“That’s the rebellious side of Hackney that you see quite late at night, maybe near one of the bagel shops. I suppose it’s the alternative side of Hackney, still reminiscent of the punk culture that fixates around there.”

displayImages.caption:
High Top
“This one’s my favourite. I spotted it around my studio and it was the second one that I painted. I liked how graphic it looked, and then this gave me the encouragement to push the project further. I liked how bold it was, how drastic.”
displayImages.altText: High Top
displayImages.cleanCaption:
High Top
“This one’s my favourite. I spotted it around my studio and it was the second one that I painted. I liked how graphic it looked, and then this gave me the encouragement to push the project further. I liked how bold it was, how drastic.”

displayImages.caption:
Hoxton Fin
 “This one definitely represents the night time of Hackney, the club scene and going out. The fin’s like a shark fin, looking out for people, sort of on the prowl. It’s the party aspect of Hackney, definitely Hoxton Square, quite late at night.”
displayImages.altText: Hoxton Fin
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Hoxton Fin
 “This one definitely represents the night time of Hackney, the club scene and going out. The fin’s like a shark fin, looking out for people, sort of on the prowl. It’s the party aspect of Hackney, definitely Hoxton Square, quite late at night.”

displayImages.caption:
Orthodox Locks
“Hackney has a very big Jewish community, particularly around my studio. I’ll often see Orthodox Jewish people and I really wanted to get across this mix of tradition, haircut and style.”
displayImages.altText: Orthodox Locks
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Orthodox Locks
“Hackney has a very big Jewish community, particularly around my studio. I’ll often see Orthodox Jewish people and I really wanted to get across this mix of tradition, haircut and style.”

displayImages.caption:
Pigtails
“This reminds me of the area I live in – I see all these kids running to Rushmore School in the morning. I wanted to capture that side of Hackney: there are lots of schools. I liked the idea of the mixture of playful but preppy - childish but trying to be grown up.”
displayImages.altText: Pigtails
displayImages.cleanCaption:
Pigtails
“This reminds me of the area I live in – I see all these kids running to Rushmore School in the morning. I wanted to capture that side of Hackney: there are lots of schools. I liked the idea of the mixture of playful but preppy - childish but trying to be grown up.”

displayImages.caption:
American Tourist
“This is the sort of person I see quite a lot around Shoreditch High Street, where Hackney’s becoming different and exciting and new. You get a lot of tourists on the look out for new trends.” Photograph: Daniel Frost
displayImages.altText: American Tourist
displayImages.cleanCaption:
American Tourist
“This is the sort of person I see quite a lot around Shoreditch High Street, where Hackney’s becoming different and exciting and new. You get a lot of tourists on the look out for new trends.”

cards.title: Gorilla holds out his hands for favourite treat
cards.rawTitle: Gorilla holds out his hands for favourite treat

item.title: Gorilla holds out his hands for favourite treat
item.trailText: Video from ZSL London Zoo shows Kumbuka, one of the zoo's western lowland gorillas, holding out his hand for a handful of his favourite snack, brown rice
item.standFirst: Video from ZSL London Zoo shows Kumbuka, one of the zoo's western lowland gorillas, holding out his hand for his favourite snack, brown rice. London zoo's gorilla troop are very partial to the highly nutritious rice that keepers scatter over the enclosure to encourage the apes to forage
